header.article_title: Great, The Uber Driver is Playing His F*cking Mixtape

body.p: BOSTON, MA—Craig Brennan and friends got into their Uber Saturday to head to the bars. Their driver, named Jon, seemed normal enough until he kept insisting he “is the next big thing” in rap. “Yeah, the 30 minute drive into the city wasn’t bad until he wouldn’t stop bringing up his art.” After the insisting we go to his Soundcloud page, Brennan’s friend, Charlene Nguyen, asked him to play his music. “Terrible mistake” said Brennan. Before Nguyen could finish, Jon began talking about his mixtape’s upcoming release, and started off by playing a song called “Infected.” With an overly heavy bass and mediocre Garageband synth, you almost couldn’t make out his weak rhythm and shaky voice. “Yeah, after the awkward silence and haphazard ‘that was great,’ we thought he’d put Drake back on. But then he played three more.” The next one was called “The Reelest,” and featured a line about fishing for money. On top of that, he appeared to be singing along to his music, and kept looking back for reassurance. “I’ve never had to force a smile more than I did for Jon’s rap, said fellow victim Nick Martin. Reports indicate that Jon’s mixtape is set to release on December 8th.

report.p: The draft is well written and adheres to the style of writing of a typical satirical article such as one in The Onion. The use of an accurate rhetorical situation which is relevant to satirical articles further validates the content in the body paragraph. Satirical articles are meant to be a humorous take on articles published in conventional sources (i.e. The New York Times). I feel that this article has many qualities that help it fit into this satirical article category very well. The focus of this article is on one particular event in one night, which is what many satirical articles are about. The story having a funny character is one definite sign that it is a satirical article. There is a good incorporation of current humor– the whole concept of mixtapes is very relevant in today’s society where small time rappers try to promote themselves through their music. Further, I like how there is an insight into the thoughts and feelings of the characters who are involved in the scene. Although satirical articles are not meant for character development, I feel that a scene is built and situations are developed when there is a general understanding of the characters– this was done well by the author. One aspect on language which can be slightly improved on is how everything in the article seems to be over-emphasized. For example, “kept saying that he raps”, “terrible mistake”, “overly heavy bass”, “barely make out”, “played three more”. Some details may be better if they’re left un-emphasized. Overall, I feel that the article is very well written and sticks by the conventions of satirical articles with good use of character and scene development which makes for a thorough rhetorical situation development. One little aspect of the article that may be reconsidered is the amount of words/ phrases that are emphasized to add effect. It is a good habit to have, especially in satirical articles, however not always.
